main_definition: a formal way to indicate that something is being done or will be done at the present time, often used in legal or official documents.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to introduce a directive or order issued by an authority or institution
meanings_and_examples.example: The company has decided to change its policy. Hereby, all employees must submit their requests for leave at least two weeks in advance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to emphasize the immediacy of a statement or action being made
meanings_and_examples.example: After careful consideration, I hereby declare our new business strategy effective from next month.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used in legal documents to indicate that something is happening at this precise moment or time
meanings_and_examples.example: The parties have agreed on the terms of the contract. Hereby, all rights and responsibilities are defined as per the agreement.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to signify a formal decision or action being taken in writing or recorded officially
meanings_and_examples.example: He will hereby be appointed as the new head of the department starting from next week.
